messageBody:
Ed,

> I have a set of tests in a single Unit, say test1() and test2(). I
> want to execute my set of tests over the elements in a list of
> resources where each resource is expensive to allocate. For example,
> let's say I had a list of databases (e.g., OracleDB, MySQLDB, ...),
> and I want to execute my set of tests over each DB. Creating a DB
> connection is expensive so I only want to create one DB connection per
> test set as follows:
>
> Create OracleDB connection
> test1()
> test2()
> Create MySQLDB connection
> test1()
> test2()
>
> What's the best way to do this? I know about parameterized JUnit
> tests; however, this calls the constructor for EACH test. I only want
> to allocate a DB connection per test set. Perhaps there's some
> @BeforeParameter hook that is only executed when the parameter values
> changes, not for each test.

Sounds like what you want isn't a parameterized test, but a test
fixture. Create an abstract base class for the test methods, and give it
a getConnection() abstract method. Then subclass it, once per DB, and in
each subclass, use @BeforeClass and @AfterClass to do the expensive
stuff. Each subclass's getConnection() will return its (static) connection.
